body:
### Hello friends,
Depending on the current source, it is possible to get output for different platforms in a responsive mode!

- I know you have worked hard and this is admirable. In my opinion, we need to improve the bitcoin wallet, especially the user interface part.
- I know that the C++ community has a great deal of expertise in this area and can provide the best output for the bitcoin community that it deserves!

**Therefore, we can work together to improve it as much as possible, and I, as a member of C++ community, have some suggestions:**

1. Reviewing and Redesigning the codes of the bitcoin core wallet, especially the UI and improving the UX according to [this process](https://github.com/BitcoinDesign/Bitcoin-Core-App).
2. Reviewing and improving the modern user interface in a completely responsive way for desktop, mobile and even web assembly platforms in the future! According to [this discuss](https://github.com/bitcoin-core/gui-qml) based on Qt Quick technology.
3. This [concept of design](https://www.figma.com/file/GaCoOSNHB2yMB9ThiDtred/Bitcoin-Core-App-Main?node-id=1035%3A1883) designed by friends is very admirable and we can start developing it based on QML according to this concept. I prefer a single implementation of components for cross-platform and responsive UI. It is a better choice because:

**This offer has advantages:**
- Fast and comprehensive updates.
- Fast improvement and avoiding waste of time on multi-platform development
- Providing stable and reliable output on all platforms.

4. Adding support for CMake tool as a fast and reliable tool. Build with CMake. Build with Confidence ([CMake](https://cmake.org/) slogan!). It helps us to provide fast and synchronized output on target platforms.
5. Upgrading Interface codes to Qt6 and also core codes to C++20 in the future as a goal.
6. It is important for me to pay attention to the support of new technologies such as web assembly (WASM).

At last, I thank my friends for their valuable efforts and hope that I can contribute to improve the project.

_**Sincerely Kambiz!**_
title: Discussion: Improving the current source code to support full cross-platform.
